channel.title: My compiler fails :/ pleas help
channel.description:
[b][size=12pt][font=arial black]oh thanks guys, one other prob, so im working on a PI, k? and whenever i save my work and compile it doesnt do anything :( like if i add a npc in the spawn-config, it will spawn but anything like it commands, or client.java, ex. welcome message, it wont change :/ any ideas? maybe its my compile.bat file?? can someone gimme the code to theres?[/font][/size][/b]
this is what my compiler shows~~~~ [code=java]Compiling - Project Insanity Please wait patiently... 'javac' is not recognized as an internal or external command, operable program or batch file. Press any key to continue . . .
[/code]

and as for those errors you have, post them in the help section, super easy…
Just missing a ) for the first error.

or ill try and reconnect in a bit,[/quote]
what’s a dosche bag? Doubt you fixed it.

item.title: My compiler fails :/ pleas help
item.dc:creator: @imsuperman05 imsuperman05
item.description:
@imsuperman05 wrote:

[quote=“purestmage74, post:15, topic:421329”]Ill give you a couple here to try, all the same paths, just different ways of searching:
Just simply replace the method inside your batch file LEAVE EVERYTHING AFTER “-classpath” there!, that’s telling java which folders to look for class files in and compile.

And if this still doesn’t work…
I’d be happy to teamviewer you and fix it quickly.

@echo off
@color 0a
@title Compiling: Server Binarys

:main
cls
echo Compiling, please wait...
"C:\Program Files\Java\jdk1.6.0_29/bin\javac.exe" -classpath deps/log4j-1.2.15.jar;deps/jython.jar;deps/xstream.jar;deps/mina.jar;deps/mysql.jar;deps/poi.jar;deps/slf4j.jar;deps/slf4j-nop.jar -d bin src\server\event\*.java src\server\model\items\*.java src\server\model\minigames\*.java src\server\model\npcs\*.java src\server\model\objects\*.java src\server\model\players\*.java src\server\model\players\skills\*.java src\server\model\players\packets\*.java src\server\model\shops\*.java src\server\net\*.java src\server\task\*.java src\server\util\*.java src\server\world\*.java src\server\util\log\*.java src\server\*.java src\server\world\map\*.java
:end
pause
goto main

One of those above, i should guarantee to work, only problem is if once again:

  1. “29” is not you java version
  2. Different drive instead of “C:”[/quote]
    3 years of coding and you don’t even know this. Nothing you said is the solution.

Read full topic

item.title: My compiler fails :/ pleas help
item.dc:creator: @purestmage74 purestmage74
item.description:
@purestmage74 wrote:

Ill give you a couple here to try, all the same paths, just different ways of searching:
Just simply replace the method inside your batch file LEAVE EVERYTHING AFTER “-classpath” there!, that’s telling java which folders to look for class files in and compile.

And if this still doesn’t work…
I’d be happy to teamviewer you and fix it quickly.

@echo off
@color 0a
@title Compiling: Server Binarys

:main
cls
echo Compiling, please wait...
"C:\Program Files\Java\jdk1.6.0_29/bin\javac.exe" -classpath deps/log4j-1.2.15.jar;deps/jython.jar;deps/xstream.jar;deps/mina.jar;deps/mysql.jar;deps/poi.jar;deps/slf4j.jar;deps/slf4j-nop.jar -d bin src\server\event\*.java src\server\model\items\*.java src\server\model\minigames\*.java src\server\model\npcs\*.java src\server\model\objects\*.java src\server\model\players\*.java src\server\model\players\skills\*.java src\server\model\players\packets\*.java src\server\model\shops\*.java src\server\net\*.java src\server\task\*.java src\server\util\*.java src\server\world\*.java src\server\util\log\*.java src\server\*.java src\server\world\map\*.java
:end
pause
goto main

One of those above, i should guarantee to work, only problem is if once again:

  1. “29” is not you java version
  2. Different drive instead of “C:”

Read full topic

item.title: My compiler fails :/ pleas help
item.dc:creator: @purestmage74 purestmage74
item.description:
@purestmage74 wrote:

No, the “The system cannot find the path specified.” is simply saying that the java version isn’t set right.

So look through the paths i told you earlier, and in the batch file replace the 24 with your java version.
“C:\Program Files\Java\jdk1.6.0_24\bin\javac.exe”

Start Button > My Computer > C: > Program Files > Java > YOUR VERSION IS HERE.

Should be Local Disk C: after “My Computer” in start button.

Read full topic

item.title: My compiler fails :/ pleas help
item.dc:creator: @purestmage74 purestmage74
item.description:
@purestmage74 wrote:

lol, no no no no.

Like this:

@echo off
COLOR C
ECHO Compiling - Project Insanity
ECHO Please wait patiently...
TITLE Compile - Server
"C:\Program Files\Java\jdk1.6.0_24\bin\javac.exe" -classpath deps/log4j-1.2.15.jar;deps/jython.jar;deps/xstream.jar;deps/mina.jar;deps/mysql.jar;deps/poi.jar;deps/slf4j.jar;deps/slf4j-nop.jar -d bin src\server\event\*.java src\server\model\items\*.java src\server\model\minigames\*.java src\server\model\npcs\*.java src\server\model\objects\*.java src\server\model\players\*.java src\server\model\players\skills\*.java src\server\model\players\packets\*.java src\server\model\shops\*.java src\server\net\*.java src\server\task\*.java src\server\util\*.java src\server\world\*.java src\server\util\log\*.java src\server\*.java src\server\world\map\*.java
pause

The second way u had it, it wouldn’t of compiled right.

java version:

Start button/my computer/ program files or (program files (x86))/java/java version will be here.

Read full topic

item.title: My compiler fails :/ pleas help
item.dc:creator: @mock_pro mock pro
item.description:
@mock_pro wrote:

[quote=“purestmage74, post:2, topic:421329”]Simple fix, sometimes it wont read just “Java” or “Javac” you have to replace that line with:

"C:\Program Files\Java\jdk1.6.0_24\bin\javac.exe"

Hope it helps, of course set it to your directory of java, and your version should replace my version “24”.[/quote]
So instead of@echo off COLOR C ECHO Compiling - Project Insanity ECHO Please wait patiently... TITLE Compile - Server javac -classpath deps/log4j-1.2.15.jar;deps/jython.jar;deps/xstream.jar;deps/mina.jar;deps/mysql.jar;deps/poi.jar;deps/slf4j.jar;deps/slf4j-nop.jar -d bin src\server\event\*.java src\server\model\items\*.java src\server\model\minigames\*.java src\server\model\npcs\*.java src\server\model\objects\*.java src\server\model\players\*.java src\server\model\players\skills\*.java src\server\model\players\packets\*.java src\server\model\shops\*.java src\server\net\*.java src\server\task\*.java src\server\util\*.java src\server\world\*.java src\server\util\log\*.java src\server\*.java src\server\world\map\*.java pause
i would put

@echo off COLOR C ECHO Compiling - Project Insanity ECHO Please wait patiently... TITLE Compile - Server "C:\Program Files\Java\jdk1.6.0_24\bin\javac.exe" pause
?? and thanks alot!! and i know this sounds really stupid but how do i check what java i have?? sorry im new to this

Read full topic

item.title: My compiler fails :/ pleas help
item.dc:creator: @purestmage74 purestmage74
item.description:
@purestmage74 wrote:

Simple fix, sometimes it wont read just “Java” or “Javac” you have to replace that line with:

"C:\Program Files\Java\jdk1.6.0_24\bin\javac.exe"

Hope it helps, of course set it to your directory of java, and your version should replace my version “24”.

Read full topic
